messages.subject: WAS - Re: Do as I say...Now: Yelling/sensitivity: A eureka moment!
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 8/7/2007 2:06:48 P.M. Pacific Daylight Time, starsuncloud@comcast.net writes: but I  shouldn t have yelled like that. He s really sensitive
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 8/7/2007 2:06:48 P.M. Pacific Daylight Time,
starsuncloud@... writes:

but I shouldn't have yelled like that. He's
really sensitive to any kind of loud voice. If you have an edge of
irritation in your voice he'll say "don't yell at me". He's a great
barometer for me.



____________________________________________

Wow...Ren! That's Julian. And you know what's REALLY interesting?! Is the
more I unschool, the more sensitive he is and the more able and willing he is to
speak UP and say the same things! He says, "Don't yell at me!" and even
"Don't hurt me!" (though I do NOT hit, spank, whatnot, they have seen me slam
things in anger...a thing I have worked long an hard on and am doing QUITE well!
:) ) which I think is wonderful - he is expressing himself so much better
than he used to. Because he is HEARD now, is what I can get from these changes.
And I am so happy and grateful for that. My barometer, for sure! and to
think most parents that new us thought I was a radical, laid back parent
BEFORE...lol...

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
